Topic.Title: Yahoo down on Chinese (Alibaba) breakdown.

Message.Msg: I think negative impact is minimal. Big Institutional investors think long-term when they invest so wheen they invest in Alibaba they are in for the long haul. This is very clear to all Alibaba Group is the largest e-marketplace in China and in Asia as well. They dominate business to business as well as consumer to consumer, no question about. Alipay is the biggest online system in China way bigger than Pay-pal. Alibaba now is beginning to have their own search business and started this business with major partnership. With that business data, Alibaba Group will dominate China for a long long time. What is happening now in China is simply short-term noises.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Finance hacked?

Message.Msg: Inaccurate financial feeds from third party suppliers is not that unusual for Y!. Bigger problem is that Y! partners from foreign countries have hacked Y! email and Y! has turned off the customer support telephone numbers in order to avoid addressing the problem.

Message.Title: How much control does Yahoo have over Aliba IPO
Message.Msg: In view of wacky Chinese securities and corporate ownership laws.-Reuters had story about risks of China IPOs structured to allow operation but lack of real control. The structure, known as a variable interest entity, or VIE, is designed to let companies bypass Chinese government bans on foreign ownership in some business sectors. A popular corporate form in Chinese IPOs, the VIE structure was used in this month's successful, $91 million (59 million pounds) flotation of Light (Other OTC: LGSXY - news) -in-the-Box Holding Co Ltd , for instance. That IPO has richly rewarded investors, with the shares up 57 percent from their IPO price of $9.50, even after a steep decline recently amid a broad market selloff. VIEs include several components: a Chinese business with a license to operate in a restricted sector; a foreign holding company; and a web of contracts meant to give outside investors control and access to profits, but not actual corporate ownership.

Message.Title: Yahoo CEO Mayer Adding Mobile Users After App Overhauls
Message.Msg: Yahoo! Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marissa Mayer said the company has seen a surge in mobile users since revamping applications for e-mail and photo-sharing. “All of our growth is going to start with our users,” Mayer said today at the company’s annual meeting in Santa Clara, California. The number of daily active users for the Flickr photo app has jumped 50 percent since it was redesigned in May, while use of mobile e-mail has climbed 70 percent since an overhaul in April, she said.
